channel.title: Antarctica - Ice Station Rescue
channel.desc: Documentary which follows the everyday people battling in the most extreme environment on earth to move Halley VI, a vital polar research station.

channel.title: Moviedrome
channel.desc: An introduction to 1973's cult folk horror film The Wicker Man.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Wicker Man
channel.desc: A puritan police sergeant arrives on a Scottish island in search of a missing girl, who the Pagan locals claim never existed. Contains some sexual content and disturbing scenes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Moviedrome
channel.desc: Mark Cousins introduces Nicolas Roeg's haunting 1973 thriller Don't Look Now, starring Donald Sutherland and Julie Christie.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Don't Look Now
channel.desc: Acclaimed mystery about a couple grieving the loss of their daughter in a tragic accident. Contains some strong language, explicit sexual content, some violence an.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Westwood
channel.desc: Documentary film reflecting on the extraordinary career of Dame Vivienne Westwood, looking closely at her artistry, her activism and her cultural significance. Contains some strong language.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Rise of the Nazis
channel.desc: Germany is losing the war, but Hitler refuses to contemplate surrender. Instead, he pursues a policy of total war, which plays out as a psychological drama within his inner circle.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: A Summer Journey
channel.desc: Angela Rippon travels from the River Severn's source at Plynlimon down to Gloucester. En route, she discovers the birthplace of the industrial revolution and goes afloat in a coracle.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Canal Boat Diaries
channel.desc: Life on board a narrowboat with Robbie Cumming. Robbie battles his way through blanket weed on the Shropshire Union Canal and discovers industrial secrets in Audlem, Cheshire.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Rise of the Nazis
channel.desc: At the end of March 1945, Nazi Germany is on the brink of collapse, and with Berlin under daily bombardment, Hitler has permanently retreated to his bunker.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Lost Home Movies of Nazi Germany
channel.desc: Amateur footage that reveals both civilian and military life in WWII Germany. Contains some violence and disturbing scenes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Sky at Night
channel.desc: The team explore one of the newest areas of modern astronomy, the search for exoplanets, the distant worlds that orbit stars beyond our own solar system.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Nicholas Shakespeare Remembers
channel.desc: Mario Vargas Llosa. Nicholas Shakespeare looks back on his film about Peruvian novelist Mario Vargas Llosa.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Mario Vargas Llosa
channel.desc: of the Novelist Who Would Be President. Documentary following novelist Mario Vargas Llosa in his bid to become president of Peru.
